name: SpringHill Suites Lehi at Thanksgiving Point

reviews.text: The room was very good and spacious with separate sitting area. Fitness room and swimming pool were a bit small. Breakfast was simple but ok. Good location near Highway.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with spacious rooms

reviews.text: The Thanksgiving Point/Lehi area is a rapidly growing area for business so when I came to stay recently I was pleasantly surprised and pleased with the convenience of the location. The room was a very good size and was more than comfortable for a weeks stay. The services in the area were limited with a very small choice of restaurants close by. There's no restaurant (other than for breakfast) at the hotel so a car is essential to get out of the area and find other things and with American Fork and Sandy 10/15 minutes in either direction you're not far from a world of choice. The reception staff were most helpful and friendly, very welcoming. The area is very exposed to the elements so wind is a daily occurrence, made to feel even worse when there's snow. Really good hotel overall.
reviews.title: Good for a business stay

reviews.text: Dont expect anything much different at this SS than you get any any other...it falls right in line with the others. The location is nice as it is right next door to Thanksgiving Point. It is a Nature type place and they have a pretty good Deli type resteraunt to make up for the lack of lunch or dinner available from the hotel. Also has a movie theater (8) nearby. The access has been re-routed and it is harder to get to off of the interstate now so know you will have to make several turns to get to the hotel now. Rooms are clean (did find a hair in my tub though...my pet peeve!) and well appointed. Standard SS furniture and a good size LG flat screen shared by the living room and bedroom areas...36 different channels to watch. Standard shower head you get at most Marriott properties. Towels are rather small and thin...took two to dry me off fully. Only soap, shampoo, and conditioner provided. No lotion or other items like cotton balls or q-tips in the room. Front desk people are nice enough and the market is small but well stocked for its size. Prices are more than down the street at the gas station but within what I expect to pay for the conviniance. Ovarall a good value but nothing extra special about this one than any other except the location.
reviews.title: Just like most other Springhill Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited this hotel for a family get together. It was a good hotel it almost all areas. First, the pros. I was very please with the breakfast. It was a good variety and better than the average hotel breakfast. The staff was extremely friendly, and lastly, the hotel was in a great centralized location. The cons: There were really very minimal cons, neither of which would prevent me from staying here again. First off, my wife and I stayed on the third floor in the back of the building. I don't know exactly WHY but for some reason they decided to light up their back parking lot like a stadium. On the third floor, the lights come RIGHT into the room, which cause the room to be overly lit up. Which made it a little hard to sleep. The other two, are that 1 it was really hot in the hotel (easily fixed with some AC) and the hallways were really small.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with minimal drawbacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: None of the cons would stop me from staying here again
reviews.title: Excellent Extended Stay

reviews.text: I wanted to spend the weekend at a local property as a getaway, and found the Springhill Suites more than adequate. The staff were friendly, the property clean. Every morning, a full buffet breakfast was served, with meat, egg, cereals, waffles and assorted breads and juices, along with hot coffee or teas. I especially enjoyed the super clean indoor swimming pool and hot spa, towels provided.
reviews.title: Top notch for an off-the-freeway hotel

reviews.text: The room was large enough, with a sitting area (sofa and chair), a desk, and a wetbar with coffeemaker, microwave oven, mini fridge and cabinets for storing foodstuffs. The large flat screen TV swivels from the sitting area to the bed area. The bath is separated into a sink/vanity area and the shower/toilet area. Toiletries are provided, and anything you've forgotten can be purchased at the mini-mart down in the lobby. They also sell drinks and snacks, plus some meal items that can be warmed up in the microwaves.
reviews.title: Merely Adequate Business Hotel

reviews.text: This property is located next door to Thanksgiving Point, where you can shop, eat, tour the history museum, or see a movie. There is a secret garden in between the hotel and the Point, where you can relax to the sounds of babbling creeks and waterfalls. There is also a back patio behind the hotel with lounge chairs and a gazebo for relaxing.
reviews.title: Good base for different types of fun

reviews.text: I love this hotel, and will be back when I need time away from work and home.
reviews.title: Avoid rooms 202 and 204

reviews.text: Thi
reviews.title: A great quality hotel for a great price

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic. We have always loved the SpringHill Suites by Marriott, but this one stood out even more. It had a great garden in the back that you could stroll through for hours. My kids absolutely loved it! The hotel was clean, the rooms were great, beds were comfortable, pool was the perfect temperature. I stay at hotels a dozen times a year and this was the best of all of our stays.
reviews.title: Perfect location and luxury you can afford!

reviews.text: This was the headquarters located for our family reunion. My brother and his wife won
reviews.title: PERFECT

reviews.text: the competition to host for 2010. The scenery around the hotel was wonderful. One
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: night one, we cooked outside in the gazebo and patio. It was great. My room was
reviews.title: Quiet & Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: perfect size, decor...nice and sunny, bright, and clean. The maid brought me extra
reviews.title: Nice hotel with amenities, location and access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in October for 3 nights before and after the Pony Express ultra marathon. It was very easy to get to from Salt Lake City, less than 30 minutes away from where we were.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: The room was exceptionally clean and fairly spacious, and consistent with the photographs on the hotel's website. The lobby area was welcoming. The breakfast was a bit "meh" compared with the breakfast that we had at the SpringHill Suites at the airport but there were plenty of eggs, some fruit, and standard breakfast fare. Coffee was available all day, which was great. The hotel is right next to parts of Thanksgiving Point, including several of the restaurants located in that complex. The hotel also had a cozy outdoor lounge area with a gas firepit and comfy lounge chairs. The pool was pretty small but clean.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Utah County

reviews.text: The room had a minifridge, coffeemaker with coffee and utensils, and a small bar sink, which was useful.
reviews.title: Great for travelers passing through

reviews.text: All in all, our stay was wonderful and an excellent value and if we are ever in the area again, we will definitely stay here!
reviews.title: Terrific staff!

reviews.text: I went to Provo for the BYU - Washington State game and stayed at the Springhill Suites in Lehi as hotels closer to Provo were not available because of the game traffic. It was a clean and comfortable room. My only issue was a clogged tub that had me standing in 3 inches of soapy water while I showered. I guess that will happen. The hotel is actually off the Thanksgiving Point exit. I was coming from Salt Lake and took the Lehi exit which had me back-track to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel ! Great Staff!!!

aka: Springhill Suites Lehi At Thanksgiving Point Hotel
